page.title: 08EDUCATION - GODSHILL SCHOOL
page.content: Education - Godshill Primary School Founded in 1615 from money given by Lady Ann Worsley of Appuldurcombe,the present building was erected in 1826 by Lord Yarborough. Then the school contained 2 rooms, 1 for boys and the other for girls. In 1968 the school was enlarged by a Hall, 2 classrooms,kitchen and cloakrooms and the 1826 building was modified to provide staffroom, stockroom, cloakrooms, Headteacher's room and Infant classroom. In 1979 part of School House was converted to provide a Library and Resources room.Now there are 80 children, 2 full-time teachers, 1 half-time teacher, Headteacher, 2 ancillaries, secretary and caretaker.School dinners are provided by a Cook with 2 helpers. 2 SMSAs work one hour each serving the meals and looking after the children.
